section.title: Introduction
section.p: Whenever anybody on your team edits a card or page, Mingle saves the previous version and maintains a full history of all changes. You can view changes to pages as they happen from the main History tab, but you can view the history of the page from its History component. From here, you can also view previous versions of the page.

bullets.title: You may want to view previous versions of a page if:
bullets.item: you or a team member accidentally overwrote a page's content
you want to view information captured at an earlier stage of your project
you remembered that there was some useful information or attachment in a previous version of a page.

bullets.title: For each page, Mingle shows:
bullets.item: who updated the page and when (relative to your current time)
a summary of the changes made for each version
a link to view a previous page version.

section.title: How to view page history and previous versions

steps.item: Sign in to Mingle and navigate to the project with the pages you want to view (if you're not already working within the project).

item.p: Locate the page with the history you want to view.
You can click the Project admin tab, Pages link to view a list of all pages within the project.
You may also find pages attached to cards or other pages, or from Mingle's search.
Click the page name link to open the page.
Mingle displays the contents of the page, with the History component at the top-right side of the page.
If you would like to view a previous version of a page, locate the version you want to view and click the View link.
Mingle displays the previous page version, with a summary of the version number and a link to return to the latest version.
